definitions: software program designed to run on smartphones, tablets, or other mobile devices
examples: Download the weather app to check today's forecast
She developed a fitness app that tracks daily workouts

definitions: ability to see, hear, or become aware of something through the senses
way of regarding, understanding, or interpreting something based on mental impression
examples: Our perception of color varies in different lighting conditions
The drug can alter sensory perception and cause hallucinations
Public perception of the company changed after the scandal broke
His perception of the situation was completely different from mine

definitions: person visiting a place, person, or institution for a particular purpose or period
examples: The museum welcomes thousands of visitors each month from around the world
Please sign in at the visitor's desk before entering the building

definitions: state of being strikingly different from something else when compared side by side
act of comparing in order to show differences between things or concepts
examples: The contrast between wealth and poverty was evident in the city
The bright colors create a sharp contrast against the dark background
The teacher used contrast to explain the differences between democracy and dictatorship
In contrast to last year, sales have increased significantly this quarter

definitions: ability to make considered decisions or come to sensible conclusions about matters
formal decision given by a court of law regarding a case or dispute
examples: Trust your judgment when choosing the right candidate for the position
His poor judgment in financial matters led to significant losses
The court will deliver its judgment on the case next Monday morning
The judgment awarded damages of fifty thousand dollars to the plaintiff

definitions: person chosen or appointed to act or speak for another or others in particular
typical of a particular group, class, or body of opinion showing characteristic qualities
examples: Each district elects a representative to serve in the state legislature
The sales representative will demonstrate our new product line tomorrow
This painting is representative of the artist's early experimental period
The survey included a representative sample of voters from different backgrounds

definitions: route over or through mountains connecting two areas or valleys
document or card giving permission to enter or leave a place
act of throwing, kicking, or hitting a ball to another player
examples: The mountain pass was blocked by snow during the winter months
Travelers used the narrow pass to cross between the two valleys
Show your security pass to the guard at the entrance gate
Students need a hall pass to leave the classroom during lessons
The quarterback threw a perfect pass to the receiver for a touchdown
She made a brilliant pass to her teammate who scored the goal

definitions: government in power, especially one considered authoritarian or undemocratic in nature
systematic plan or regulated system especially for diet, therapy, or exercise
examples: The military regime ruled the country for over twenty years with force
Citizens protested against the oppressive regime demanding democratic elections immediately
The doctor recommended a strict exercise regime to improve her health
His daily regime includes meditation, yoga, and a balanced vegetarian diet

definitions: person, company, or country that makes, grows, or supplies goods or commodities
person responsible for financial and managerial aspects of making a film or show
examples: Brazil is the world's largest producer of coffee beans and sugar
Local producers sell fresh vegetables at the farmers market every Saturday
The film producer secured funding and hired the director for the project
She worked as a television producer for several successful drama series

definitions: way or course taken in getting from a starting point to a destination
examples: The delivery driver follows the same route through the neighborhood every morning
We took the scenic route along the coast to enjoy the views

definitions: intentionally false statement made to deceive someone or avoid telling the truth
examples: Telling a lie to your parents will only make the situation worse
The politician's lie about campaign funds destroyed his credibility with voters

definitions: person who analyzes or interprets complex data or information in a specific field
examples: The financial analyst predicted a downturn in the stock market this quarter
A systems analyst evaluated our computer network and recommended several upgrades

definitions: person of the sex that can bear offspring or produce eggs
relating to or characteristic of women, girls, or the female sex
examples: The company aims to hire more female executives for leadership positions
The female students outnumbered male students in the biology program
Female mammals typically care for their young after giving birth naturally
The female connector fits into the corresponding male part of the cable

definitions: physical or mental condition that limits a person's movements, senses, or activities substantially
examples: The new building includes ramps and elevators to accommodate people with disabilities
Her learning disability required specialized teaching methods and extra support in school

definitions: consideration or estimate of similarities or differences between two things or people
examples: The comparison between the two smartphones revealed significant differences in battery life
In comparison to her sister, she was much more outgoing and sociable

definitions: classification or ranking of someone or something based on comparative assessment of quality
examples: The restaurant received a five-star rating from the food critic last week
Check the safety ratings before buying a new car for your family

definitions: grounds and buildings of a university, college, or school forming a distinct area
examples: Students gathered on the campus lawn for the spring festival celebration
The new dormitory is located on the north side of the campus

definitions: part of a tree growing out from the trunk or from a bough
division or office of a large organization operating in a particular area
examples: The storm broke several branches off the old oak tree last night
Birds built their nest on a sturdy branch near the top
She works at the downtown branch of the national bank
The company opened a new branch in Singapore to expand operations

definitions: chivalrous, courteous, or honorable man who treats others with respect and consideration
man of good social position, especially one of wealth and leisure in society
examples: He held the door open like a true gentleman for the elderly woman
The gentleman offered his seat to the pregnant woman on the bus
The gentleman owned several properties and lived off his investment income comfortably
Victorian gentlemen were expected to follow strict codes of social behavior

definitions: resistance or dissent expressed in action or argument against something or someone
group of political parties opposed to the government or party in power
examples: The proposal faced strong opposition from environmental groups and local residents
Despite opposition from her family, she pursued her dream career anyway
The opposition party criticized the government's new tax policy in parliament
Leaders of the opposition called for immediate elections following the scandal

definitions: instance of striking or being struck by someone or something with force
thing or person that is very popular or successful with the public
examples: The boxer delivered a powerful hit to his opponent's jaw
The baseball player got three hits in yesterday's championship game
The new song became an instant hit on streaming platforms worldwide
The movie was the biggest hit of the summer box office

definitions: person who is proficient in sports and other forms of physical exercise
examples: The Olympic athlete trained six hours daily to prepare for the games
Professional athletes must maintain strict diets and exercise routines throughout the season

definitions: space or gap that allows passage or access through something
beginning or initial part of something such as a book, play, or game
available position or opportunity for employment in an organization
examples: The cat squeezed through a small opening in the fence to escape
Cover the opening with plastic to keep the rain out
The opening of the novel immediately captured the reader's attention completely
The chess player made an aggressive opening move to control the center
There's an opening for a marketing manager at our headquarters
Check the website regularly for new job openings in your field

definitions: solemn request for help or expression of thanks addressed to God or deity
examples: She said a prayer before eating dinner with her family each evening
The congregation joined together in prayer for peace and healing worldwide

definitions: game played between two teams of five players who score by shooting a ball through a hoop
examples: The basketball team practiced free throws for an hour after school
Professional basketball games consist of four quarters of twelve minutes each

definitions: forcible overthrow of a government or social order in favor of a new system
dramatic and wide-reaching change in the way something works or is organized
examples: The French Revolution transformed the political landscape of Europe in 1789
Citizens joined the revolution to overthrow the corrupt military dictatorship
The digital revolution has transformed how we communicate and access information globally
The industrial revolution changed manufacturing from handmade to machine-made production methods

definitions: strong feeling such as love, anger, joy, hate, or fear deriving from circumstances
examples: She struggled to control her emotions during the farewell speech at graduation
The movie evoked powerful emotions of sadness and hope in the audience

definitions: vulgar slang used to express anger, annoyance, contempt, or for emphasis
vulgar slang for the act of sexual intercourse between people
examples: He shouted a string of curses including the f-word in frustration
The movie received an R rating due to excessive use of profanity
The explicit content warning indicated scenes depicting sexual activity between characters
Such vulgar language about intimate acts is inappropriate in professional settings

definitions: raised level surface on which people or things can stand
operating system or technology framework that allows software to run
declared policy of a political party or candidate
examples: The speaker stood on a platform to address the large crowd
Passengers waited on the train platform for the next arrival
The app runs on both iOS and Android platforms seamlessly
Developers use this platform to build and deploy web applications
The candidate's platform included healthcare reform and education funding increases
Voters examined each party's platform before making their decision

definitions: rigid structure that surrounds or encloses something such as a door or window
border or case for enclosing a picture, mirror, or similar object
person's body with reference to its size or build
examples: The carpenter installed a new door frame in the renovated kitchen
The bicycle frame was made of lightweight aluminum for better performance
She bought an ornate golden frame for her wedding photograph
The museum displays priceless paintings in climate-controlled frames
Despite his small frame, he was surprisingly strong and athletic
The dress perfectly suited her tall, slender frame

definitions: serious or urgent request to the public for something needed or desired
application to a higher court for a decision to be reversed
quality that makes someone or something attractive or interesting to others
examples: The charity made an appeal for donations to help flood victims
The president's appeal for calm helped prevent further violence
Her lawyer filed an appeal against the guilty verdict last week
The case went to the court of appeal for final judgment
The tropical island's appeal lies in its pristine beaches and clear waters
The movie's appeal extended beyond teenagers to adult audiences too

definitions: latent qualities or abilities that may be developed and lead to future success
having or showing the capacity to become or develop into something in future
examples: The young athlete showed great potential for becoming a professional player someday
The teacher recognized the student's potential and provided extra guidance and support
The abandoned warehouse has potential to be converted into luxury apartments
Researchers are exploring the potential uses of this new technology in medicine

definitions: forceful or violent effort to get free of restraint or resist attack
conflict or contest requiring great effort to overcome or achieve something
examples: The prisoner's struggle to escape left marks on his wrists
There was a brief struggle before the security guards subdued the intruder
Her struggle with addiction lasted many years before successful recovery
The struggle for civil rights required decades of persistent activism

definitions: type of product manufactured by a company under a particular name or symbol
particular type or kind of something with distinct characteristics
examples: Nike is a globally recognized brand in athletic footwear and apparel
The store carries several different brands of organic coffee beans
His brand of humor appeals to younger audiences on social media
The company developed a new brand of customer service focused on personalization

definitions: laws, considered collectively, especially those enacted by a legislative body or process
examples: Congress passed new legislation to protect consumers from fraudulent business practices
Environmental legislation requires companies to reduce their carbon emissions by specific percentages

definitions: room or building equipped for scientific experiments, research, or teaching scientific subjects
examples: Students conducted chemistry experiments in the lab every Tuesday afternoon
The medical lab processes hundreds of blood samples for testing daily

definitions: number of people or things in a more or less straight line
noisy argument or serious dispute between people
examples: The students sat in neat rows facing the classroom whiteboard
Plant the seeds in straight rows six inches apart from each other
The neighbors had a terrible row about the property boundary line
Their row could be heard throughout the entire apartment building

definitions: action of coming to live permanently in a foreign country from one's homeland
examples: Immigration to the United States increased significantly during the early twentieth century
The new immigration policy affected thousands of families seeking asylum and opportunity

definitions: useful or valuable thing, person, or quality that provides benefit or advantage
item of property owned by a person or company regarded as having value
examples: Her fluency in three languages is a valuable asset in international business
The company's greatest asset is its talented and dedicated workforce
The accountant listed all company assets including buildings, equipment, and investments
Real estate assets appreciated significantly in value over the past decade

definitions: action or process of observing something or someone carefully to gain information
remark, statement, or comment based on something one has seen, heard, or noticed
examples: Scientific observation of animal behavior requires patience and careful documentation methods
The doctor kept the patient under observation for twenty-four hours
Her observation about the changing market trends proved remarkably accurate later
He made an interesting observation about the similarities between the two paintings

definitions: sensation of flavor perceived in the mouth when eating or drinking something
person's tendency to like or be interested in particular things or styles
small quantity of food or drink taken as a sample to test flavor
examples: The soup has a delicious taste of garlic and fresh herbs
Some medications can affect your sense of taste temporarily
Her taste in music ranges from classical to modern jazz
The apartment was decorated with impeccable taste and attention to detail
Would you like a taste of my chocolate cake before ordering?
The chef offered tastes of several dishes from the new menu

definitions: house and its occupants regarded as a unit for social or economic purposes
examples: The average household in this neighborhood consists of four people total
Rising prices affect every household's budget for groceries and basic necessities

definitions: fact or state of living or having objective reality in the physical world
examples: Scientists debate the existence of life on other planets in our universe
The ancient scrolls prove the existence of the lost city centuries ago

definitions: reflective surface, typically glass coated with metal, that reflects a clear image
examples: She checked her appearance in the bathroom mirror before leaving for work
The dance studio had mirrors along the entire wall for practice

definitions: person who operates the flying controls of an aircraft during flight
preliminary test or trial of something before wider implementation or release
examples: The pilot announced we would be landing in Chicago in twenty minutes
Commercial pilots must complete extensive training and pass rigorous certification exams
The school district launched a pilot program for digital learning tools
They ran a pilot study before conducting the full research project

definitions: structure or piece of furniture for holding or displaying objects upright
small booth or stall where items are displayed or sold to customers
examples: Place the music on the stand so you can read it while playing
The coat stand by the door holds umbrellas and winter jackets
She sells fresh flowers at her stand in the farmers market
The hot dog stand on the corner serves lunch to office workers

definitions: feeling of reassurance and relaxation following release from anxiety, distress, or pain
molding, carving, or stamping in which design stands out from surrounding surface
examples: She felt immense relief when the test results came back negative
The pain relief medication began working within thirty minutes of taking it
The ancient temple walls featured intricate relief sculptures of mythological scenes
The artist created a bronze relief depicting historical events from the war

definitions: white liquid produced by mammals to feed their young, especially cow's milk for human consumption
examples: Pour milk over your cereal and add fresh berries for breakfast
The recipe calls for two cups of whole milk at room temperature

definitions: statement or event that indicates possible danger, problem, or other unpleasant situation ahead
examples: The weather service issued a severe storm warning for the coastal areas
She ignored his warning about the dangerous road conditions and drove anyway

definitions: place regarded in various religions as the abode of God and the blessed dead
place, state, or experience of supreme bliss or perfect happiness
examples: Many religions teach that righteous souls go to heaven after death
She prayed to heaven for guidance during difficult times
This chocolate cake is absolute heaven for dessert lovers everywhere
After months of stress, the vacation felt like heaven to them
